abstracts.cdata!:
Tajikistan aims to deliver better
            education by fixing rundown schools and supplying them with
            furniture and basic equipment. In addition, new textbooks
            and educational materials are being printed. Teachers and
            principals receive additional training and qualifications,
            while school management and financing has been reformed. Per
            capita financing has been introduced nationwide along with
            an education management information system. Education is one
            of the most vital tools for development, prosperity and
            growth. Thus, through investing in education, Tajikistan is
            investing in one of its most valuable assets, its human
            capital. As Tajikistan contributes to the development of its
            young and growing population, it is also investing in its
            future growth and the well-being of its society at large.
